article.title: Magnetically Ordered Insulators for Advanced Spintronics

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements correctly describes the experimental configuration shown in Figure 1?
choices: The setup is designed to study charge current transport in metals.
The MOI layer serves as a conductor for both charge and spin currents.
The source (S) and drain (D) strips are made of a material with a large spin Hall angle.
The magnetization (M) of the MOI layer must be perpendicular to the spin polarization (s) for long-distance magnon transport.

multiple_choice_question.text: What conclusion can be drawn from the magnon diffusion lengths (Am,diff) reported in Table 1?
choices: Am,diff is solely determined by the type of material used for the MOI layer.
Am,diff is independent of the measurement technique and experimental conditions.
LPE-YIG consistently exhibits the longest Am,diff compared to other MOI materials and techniques.
Am,diff can vary significantly depending on factors like material properties, film thickness, and measurement method.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the underlying principle behind the novel magnetoresistance phenomena SMR and MMR?
choices: The interaction between charge currents in the NM layer and the magnetization direction in the MOI.
The manipulation of magnon flow in the MOI by an external magnetic field.
The generation of a thermal gradient across the MOI/NM interface.
The interplay between electron spin accumulation in the NM and non-equilibrium magnon distribution in the MOI.
